snippet: The loan is seen as a helpful gesture after the party’s leadership expressed admiration for President Vladimir V. Putin and a desire to break with NATO in favor of an alliance with Russia.
abstract: France's National Front party takes $11.7 million loan from Russian bank First Czech Russian Bank to help pay for various campaigns; at same time, founder Jean-Marie Le Pen takes separate $2.5 million loan from holding company belonging to former KGB agent Yuri Kudimov; money offers evidence that Russia and Europe's far-right parties are growing increasingly close.

byline.original: By SUZANNE DALEY and MAÏA de la BAUME

lead_paragraph: The loan is seen as a helpful gesture after the party’s leadership expressed admiration for President Vladimir V. Putin and a desire to break with NATO in favor of an alliance with Russia.

headline.main: French Far Right Gets Helping Hand With Russian Loan
headline.print_headline: French Far Right Gets Helping Hand With Russian Loan
